title: Canada's Trudeau hails VW plant as 'generational' investment
description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau says a massive Volkswagen electric battery plant being built in Ontario will create 3,000 jobs and represent a “generational investment” for Canada The German automaker last month announced plans for the plant in the town of St. Thomas, and Trudeau and other government ministers presented details at a news conference at the town’s railway museum

title: Coast Guard suspends search for missing boater after 3 die
description: The U.S. Coast Guard has suspended the search for a fisherman after his boat was found capsized and three companions later found dead

title: Canadian academic convicted in 1980 Paris synagogue bombing
description: A Paris court has convicted a Lebanese-Canadian academic in absentia on terrorism charges over a bombing outside a Paris synagogue in 1980 that killed four and wounded 46

title: Boat sinking on lake between Zambia and Congo leaves 15 dead
description: Congolese lawmakers say 14 people drowned in a lake on the border between Zambia and Congo when the boat they were taking across sank earlier this week

title: German police publish images of fugitive gym attack suspect
description: German police have released pictures of a man suspected of carrying out a stabbing attack at a gym in which four people were seriously wounded

title: Argentina's President Fernández won't seek reelection
description: Argentina’s President Alberto Fernández announced Friday he won’t seek reelection for a second term this year, a decision that follows months of infighting among the ruling coalition as it grapples with a fragile economy and galloping inflation

title: In photos: Muslims celebrate Eid al-Fitr around the globe
description: From Syria to Sydney, almost 2 billion Muslims around the world are celebrating the Eid al-Fitr holiday, marking the end of Ramadan.

title: Polish volunteer mortally injured in Ukraine buried at home
description: A Polish volunteer who died of wounds sustained during a humanitarian mission in eastern Ukraine has been buried in his home city in western Poland

title: Dame Edna actor Barry Humphries stable in Sydney hospital
description: Tony Award-winning comedian Barry Humphries, renowned for his garish stage persona Dame Edna Everage, is in a Sydney hospital with complications following hip surgery

title: Russia bombed its own city, Defense Ministry says
description: In the latest mishap in Vladimir Putin's war, a Russian plane dropped a bomb on Belgorod, a city near the border with Ukraine.

title: Barenboim made Berlin citizen of honor after long tenure
description: Daniel Barenboim has been made a citizen of honor of Berlin, months after he ended his three-decade tenure as the general musical director of the Berlin State Opera for health reasons

title: Man who drove into pedestrians in Berlin convicted of murder
description: A German court has convicted a 30-year-old man who drove into groups of pedestrians in Berlin last year of one count of murder and 16 of attempted murder, ordering him to be permanently held in a psychiatric hospital

title: Family joins rescued Indian climber being treated in Nepal
description: An Indian climber who was rescued after spending three days trapped in a 980-foot-deep crevasse on Mount Annapurna, the world’s 10th-highest mountain, has been joined by his family at a hospital in Nepal where he is receiving treatment

title: Retired German archbishop gives up honor after abuse report
description: A former head of the Catholic German Bishops’ Conference is giving up the country’s highest honor following scathing criticism this week of his handling of clergy abuse cases during his tenure as archbishop of Freiburg and as a personnel officer in the diocese

title: Russia's air force accidentally bombs its own city
description: A powerful bomb accidentally dropped by a Russian warplane has hit the Russian city of Belgorod near Ukraine, injuring two people

title: 10 members of same family dead in mass shooting in S. Africa
description: Police say 10 members of the same family, seven of them women, were killed in a mass shooting at a house in South Africa

title: Amid joy and tragedy, Muslims celebrate Eid al-Fitr holiday
description: The holiday of Eid al-Fitr has ushered in a day of prayers and joy for Muslims around the world

title: Nations prepare Sudan evacuations amid push for Eid holiday cease-fire
description: Fighting between the army and the Rapid Support Forces has killed more than 400 people in Sudan, as the United States prepares troops for an emergency evacuation of staff.

title: British deputy prime minister Dominic Raab resigns after bullying findings
description: British deputy prime minister Dominic Raab has resigned after a report concluded he bullied staff, in another blow for Rishi Sunak's government.

title: King Charles coronation souvenirs: The most popular, elaborate, awkward
description: Official mugs and a teddy bear are among coronation memorabilia in high demand.

title: After Dominion deal, Murdoch drops case against Australian publisher
description: Fox Corp. CEO Lachlan Murdoch has dropped a defamation case against Crikey, avoiding a public rehashing Down Under of the Dominion Voting Systems case.

title: Hong Kong bishop invites head of China's state-backed church
description: Hong Kong’s Roman Catholic bishop has invited a leader of the Communist Party-controlled group for Catholics in mainland China to visit his city

title: Thieves steal nearly $15M in gold, other cargo in Toronto airport heist
description: The high-profile theft occurred after an Air Canada flight carrying the valuables landed at Toronto Pearson International Airport.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Russia accidentally strikes its own city, state media says; NATO chief visits Kyiv
description: A Russian warplane accidentally bombed the Russian border city of Belgorod, the country’s defense ministry said, according to state media.

title: Kremlin tries to build antiwar coalition in Germany, documents show
description: Russian documents obtained by The Post show that the Kremlin has attempted to united the far right and far left in Germany in an antiwar coalition.

title: Ramadan brings a rare calm, familiar worries to Jerusalem’s Old City
description: Ramadan is meant to be a time of sacrifice that leads to renewal. But as this year’s tense holy month draws to a close, many Palestinians feel a mounting unease.

title: Guard actions in Mexico fire seen as key to who lived, died
description: When a fire broke out at a Mexican immigration detention facility last month, dramatically different reactions by guards in the men’s and women’s sections appeared to make a difference in who lived and died

title: When protesters were killed in Iran, their funerals became deadly
description: Funerals for protesters killed during Iran’s uprising have become a form of protest, as well as another grim venue for the state’s violent crackdown.

title: Arab leaders keep trying to bury the Arab Spring
description: Developments in Tunisia are the latest iteration of what Nadim Houry, executive director of the Arab Reform Initiative, described as an “authoritarian restoration” that got underway in the years after the Arab Spring.
